intro: Anil adenocarpa, commonly known as Indian gooseberry or amla, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are elliptic to ovate in shape and have a smooth, glossy surface. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by the distinctive round, green fruit with a thick, astringent skin. The fruit is rich in vitamin C and contains various bioactive compounds, making it valuable in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it well adapted to a variety of soil types and climatic conditions.
